content.query:
/* Covid-19 ECDC cases opendata set */

/* Read parquet file */
SELECT TOP 10 *
FROM OPENROWSET(
    BULK 'https://pandemicdatalake.blob.core.windows.net/public/curated/covid-19/ecdc_cases/latest/ecdc_cases.parquet',
    FORMAT = 'parquet') as rows


/* Explicitly specify schema */
SELECT TOP 10 *
FROM OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://pandemicdatalake.blob.core.windows.net/public/curated/covid-19/ecdc_cases/latest/ecdc_cases.parquet',
        FORMAT = 'parquet'
    ) WITH ( date_rep date, cases int, geo_id varchar(6) ) as rows


/* New York City Taxi opendata set */

/* Query set of parquet files */
SELECT
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime),
    passengerCount,
    COUNT(*) AS cnt
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://azureopendatastorage.blob.core.windows.net/nyctlc/yellow/puYear=2018/puMonth=*/*.snappy.parquet',
        FORMAT='PARQUET'
    ) WITH (
        tpepPickupDateTime DATETIME2,
        passengerCount INT
    ) AS nyc
GROUP BY
    passengerCount,
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime)
ORDER BY
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime),
    passengerCount;


/* Automatic schema inference */
SELECT TOP 10 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://azureopendatastorage.blob.core.windows.net/nyctlc/yellow/puYear=2018/puMonth=*/*.snappy.parquet',
        FORMAT='PARQUET'
    ) AS nyc


/* Query partitioned data */
SELECT
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime),
    passengerCount,
    COUNT(*) AS cnt
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://azureopendatastorage.blob.core.windows.net/nyctlc/yellow/puYear=*/puMonth=*/*.snappy.parquet',
        FORMAT='PARQUET'
    ) nyc
WHERE
    nyc.filepath(1) = 2017
    AND nyc.filepath(2) IN (1, 2, 3)
    AND tpepPickupDateTime BETWEEN CAST('1/1/2017' AS datetime) AND CAST('3/31/2017' AS datetime)
GROUP BY
    passengerCount,
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime)
ORDER BY
    YEAR(tpepPickupDateTime),
    passengerCount;

-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/demo-synapse/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

-- This is auto-generated code
USE nyc_taxi
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'calendar.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'

)
    ) AS [result]

-- Check data types
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''calendar.csv'',
        DATA_SOURCE = ''nyc_taxi_data_raw'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0''

)
     AS [result]'

-- Change data types day_name 6 and month_name 10
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'calendar.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
)
with (
    Day_name VARCHAR(30) 6,
    Month_name VARCHAR(30) 10

    ) AS [result]

EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''calendar.csv'',
        DATA_SOURCE = ''nyc_taxi_data_raw'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0''
)
with (
    Day_name VARCHAR(30) 6,
    Month_name VARCHAR(30) 10

    ) AS [result]'

-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/demo-synapse/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, -- Fix the header, otherwise c1,c2,etc--
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',', --default
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n' --default
    ) AS [result]

-- Examine columns data types
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/demo-synapse/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]'

-- WITH Clause to provide explicit data types
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/demo-synapse/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, -- Fix the header, otherwise c1,c2,etc--
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',', --default
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n' --default)
        )
    WITH (LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(50),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(50)
    ) AS [result]
-- Change data types to make query faster and cheaper
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/demo-synapse/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
        )
    WITH (LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(50),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(50)
    ) AS [result]'

SELECT name,collation_name from sys.databases

-- Create new database for the project
CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi;

-- Change collation to get rid of the warning and unexpected performance
USE nyc_taxi;
ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi collate Latin1_General_100_CI_AS_SC_UTF8

-- Read a csv file without header
-- Select a subset of column to optimize performance and cost
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        --HEADER_ROW = TRUE, -- Fix the header, otherwise c1,c2,etc--
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',', --default
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n' --default
    ) 
    -- Add column name
    WITH (--LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(50) 2,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) 3 --Use 2 and 3 to specify which column get the name, other wise LocationID will be named Borough
        --service_zone VARCHAR(50)
)
    AS [result]

-- Fix columns name
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        --HEADER_ROW = TRUE, -- Fix the header, otherwise c1,c2,etc--
        -- Use firstrow to ignore some rows at the top since real life data sometimes contain weird stuff at the first rows
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',', --default
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n' --default
    ) 
    -- Add column name
    WITH (location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(50) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3, --Use 2 and 3 to specify which column get the name, other wise LocationID will be named Borough
        service_zone VARCHAR(50) 4
)
    AS [result]

-- Create External Datasource
CREATE EXTERNAL data SOURCE nyc_taxi_data
WITH (
    LOCATION ='https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data'
)

CREATE EXTERNAL data SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH (
    LOCATION ='https://synapsestore123.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw'
)


SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        --HEADER_ROW = TRUE, -- Fix the header, otherwise c1,c2,etc--
        -- Use firstrow to ignore some rows at the top since real life data sometimes contain weird stuff at the first rows
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',', --default
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n' --default
    ) 
    -- Add column name
    WITH (location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(50) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3, --Use 2 and 3 to specify which column get the name, other wise LocationID will be named Borough
        service_zone VARCHAR(50) 4
)
    AS [result]

DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data

-- Find out where the datasource is pointing at
SELECT name, location FROM sys.external_data_sources

-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_type.tsv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR ='\t'
    ) AS [result]
